metadata.Title: CVE-2016-9572 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the way openjpeg 2.1.2 decodedcertain input images. Due to a logic error in the code responsible fordecoding the input image, an application using openjpeg to process imagedata could crash when processing a crafted image.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9572` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.2-1.1+deb9u2build0.1').
openjpeg: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'changes too intrusive').
